intro: Phoradendron yojoanum, commonly known as the Hawaiian coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive coral-like inflorescences. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while its woody stems can grow into shrubs or small trees. Phoradendron yojoanum is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and plays a role in the local ecosystem.
